course.subject: CSC
course.title: Networking and Telecommunications
course.catalogDescription: An examination of current computer communication technologies and their protocol structures as applied to computer networks and telecommunication systems. Topics include the physical layers, architectural elements, and information layers of a communication network; protocols; switching; routing; LANs; and WANs.

objectives.objective: Understand the architectural principles of networking.
Describe the structure and component of a layered network model.
Compare different layered network design alternatives. Identify their advantages and tradeoffs
Describe the services, functions, and inter-operation mechanisms of different layers in a layered network model.
Understand the role of each layer in a network model and how each layer facilitates its role.
Identify and compare different data link, network, and transport layer protocols.
Identify the performance properties of physical, datalink and network protocols.

outline.topic: The physical layer Wired and wireless transmission Digital modulation and multiplexing
The datalink layer Design issues and protocols Error detection and correction
The medium access control sublayer Multiple access protocols Ethernet and wireless LANs
The network layer Routing algorithms Congestion control algorithms Quality of Service Internetworking
The transport layer The transport service and protocol Congestion control
The application layer Domain Name system World-wide web and streaming media Content delivery
